title: Giuseppe Zinetti
text:
Giuseppe Zinetti (born 22 June 1958) is an Italian former professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager and former player, who played as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Career.
Zinetti was born in <a href="Leno%2C%20Italy">Leno</a>. Throughout his club career, he played for Italian sides <a href="Imolese%20Calcio%201919">Imola</a> (1976–1977), <a href="Bologna%20F.C.%201909">Bologna</a> (1977–1987), <a href="U.S.%20Triestina%20Calcio">Triestina</a> (on loan during the 1983–84 season), <a href="Delfino%20Pescara%201936">Pescara</a> (1987–1990), and <a href="A.S.%20Roma">Roma</a> (1990–1993), where he usually served as the club's second goalkeeper behind <a href="Giovanni%20Cervone">Giovanni Cervone</a>; with Roma, he won the <a href="1990%E2%80%9391%20Coppa%20Italia">Coppa Italia in 1991</a>, before ending his career with <a href="Ascoli%20Calcio%201898">Ascoli</a> in <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a>, where he was the club's second goalkeeper, retiring at the conclusion of the <a href="1993%E2%80%9394%20Serie%20B">1993–94 season</a>.
Style of play.
Regarded as one of the best Italian goalkeepers of his generation, Zinetti was an athletic and reliable shot-stopper, who was known for his efficient rather than spectacular playing style, as well as his handling, his speed when rushing off his line, and his ability to come out and claim crosses.
Honours.
Roma
